underlying_goal: To generate three highly-detailed agent specifications for the top hackathon project choices.
friction_detail: The core friction was a persistent "plan mode" bug that auto-denied file write permissions to the background agents. This required a complex and slow workaround where new agents had to be spawned to parse the output logs of the failed agents to recover the content that should have been written.
primary_success: Successfully working around the severe "plan mode" write-blocking bug by launching a second layer of "extraction" agents to parse the output transcripts of the failed agents and recover the generated content.
brief_summary: The user requested detailed agent specs for the top 3 hackathon projects. The spec-writing agents were repeatedly blocked from writing files by a persistent "plan mode" bug. Claude successfully worked around this issue by launching a second set of agents to parse the output logs of the failed agents, extract the generated content, and write it to the correct files, ultimately producing all three requested specs.
